description: Modifies the orginal Settings class provided by the user

db_connection_str.description: MongoDB connection string. Might include credentials. For more information see: https://naiveskill.com/mongodb-connection-string/
db_connection_str.title: Db Connection Str

db_name.description: Name of the database located on the MongoDB server.
db_name.title: Db Name

log_level.description: The minimum log level to capture.
log_level.title: Log Level

service_instance_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this instance across all instances of this service. A globally unique Kafka client ID will be created by concatenating the service_name and the service_instance_id.
service_instance_id.title: Service Instance Id

log_format.description: If set, will replace JSON formatting with the specified string format. If not set, has no effect. In addition to the standard attributes, the following can also be specified: timestamp, service, instance, level, correlation_id, and details
log_format.title: Log Format

plaintext_email_template.description: The plaintext template to use for email notifications
plaintext_email_template.title: Plaintext Email Template

html_email_template.description: The HTML template to use for email notifications
html_email_template.title: Html Email Template

smtp_host.description: The mail server host to connect to
smtp_host.title: Smtp Host

smtp_port.description: The port for the mail server connection
smtp_port.title: Smtp Port

use_starttls.description: Boolean flag indicating the use of STARTTLS
use_starttls.title: Use Starttls

notification_event_topic.description: Name of the event topic used to track notification events
notification_event_topic.title: Notification Event Topic

notification_event_type.description: The type to use for events containing content to be sent
notification_event_type.title: Notification Event Type

kafka_servers.description: A list of connection strings to connect to Kafka bootstrap servers.
kafka_servers.title: Kafka Servers

kafka_security_protocol.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Valid values are: PLAINTEXT, SSL.
kafka_security_protocol.title: Kafka Security Protocol

kafka_ssl_cafile.description: Certificate Authority file path containing certificates used to sign broker certificates. If a CA is not specified, the default system CA will be used if found by OpenSSL.
kafka_ssl_cafile.title: Kafka Ssl Cafile

kafka_ssl_certfile.description: Optional filename of client certificate, as well as any CA certificates needed to establish the certificate's authenticity.
kafka_ssl_certfile.title: Kafka Ssl Certfile

kafka_ssl_keyfile.description: Optional filename containing the client private key.
kafka_ssl_keyfile.title: Kafka Ssl Keyfile

kafka_ssl_password.description: Optional password to be used for the client private key.
kafka_ssl_password.title: Kafka Ssl Password

generate_correlation_id.description: A flag, which, if False, will result in an error when trying to publish an event without a valid correlation ID set for the context. If True, the a newly correlation ID will be generated and used in the event header.
generate_correlation_id.title: Generate Correlation Id

title: ModSettings
